intro: Chromatotriccum cochleatum, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a unique and recognizable appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a waxy surface. Chromatotriccum cochleatum plays a role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat.
